﻿I need help editing my fstab.  I need to correct the data for the my new swap partition.  The fstab says the swap partition is on sda3, but that is incorrect. Because the new swap is on sda5 (which is extedned partition).  I need to add the UUID and /dev of the new swap partition. I think the /dev/ would be /dev/sda5.  But I found the UUID by using sudo blkid, the only problem is where do I put it in my fstab?
replace «/dev/sda3» with «UUID=the-new-uuid» in /etc/fstab
To test, run «swapon -s» to see what swap partitions are in use, and «sudo swapon -a» to mount all swap partitions listed in /etc/fstab
isn't the new /dev/ important too?  I mean I know what the new /dev/sda5 and shouldn't that replace the old /dev/ in the fstab?
you can use /dev/sda5, UUID=the-uuid or LABEL=the-label to identify a device node. UUID is recommended.
If you use UUID, it will look it up under /dev/disk/by-uuid/, in there there should be a symbolic link pointing to /dev/sda5
